thag21.1:63.3: _Kāmakāro_: “wish-granter”. Ordinary people cannot simply get what they want.
thag21.1:63.4: _Saṅkheyyakāro_: “comprehensibility-granter”. _Saṅkheyya_ is “calculable, comprehensible”, not “after comprehension”. The Buddha has a gift for explaining things in a way that makes them comprehensible.
